meanings.definition: Whereas - conjunction: introducing a statement that contrasts with a previous statement or clause.
meanings.sent1: Whereases she said she would come, she never showed up.
meanings.sent2: I like tea, whereas my brother prefers coffee.
meanings.sent3: Whereases the cat promised not to scratch the furniture, it did so anyway.
meanings.sent4: His actions spoke louder than words, whereas his promises remained unfulfilled.
meanings.sent5: The contrast between her words and actions was stark, whereas she claimed to be honest.

meanings.definition: Whereas - adverb: in contrast or comparison with the fact that.
meanings.sent1: She was tired, whereas he was full of energy.
meanings.sent2: I prefer to walk, whereas she likes to run.
meanings.sent3: The dog slept all day, whereas the cat played non-stop.
meanings.sent4: His painting was vibrant, whereas hers was dull and monotonous.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset were breathtaking, whereas the sunrise was more subtle.
